verbs.description: disaccommodate (third-person singular simple present disaccommodates, present participle disaccommodating, simple past and past participle disaccommodated)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To put to inconvenience; to incommode.
examples: I hope this will not disaccommodate you , for you may make an ample compensation for Trinity - term , by coming to town a Sunday or two earlier than you intended […]
